addRevisionLabel.description: If addRevisionLabel is true, the appRevision label will be added to the underlying pods

annotations.description: Specify the annotations in the workload
annotations.title: annotations

cmd.description: Commands to run in the container
cmd.title: cmd

cpu.description: Number of CPU units for the service, like `0.5` (0.5 CPU core), `1` (1 CPU core)
cpu.title: cpu

env.description: Define arguments by using environment variables

value.description: The value of the environment variable
value.title: value

valueFrom.description: Specifies a source the value of this var should come from

configMapKeyRef.description: Selects a key of a config map in the pod's namespace

key.description: The key of the config map to select from. Must be a valid secret key
key.title: key

name.description: The name of the config map in the pod's namespace to select from
name.title: name

configMapKeyRef.title: configMapKeyRef

secretKeyRef.description: Selects a key of a secret in the pod's namespace

key.description: The key of the secret to select from. Must be a valid secret key
key.title: key

name.description: The name of the secret in the pod's namespace to select from
name.title: name

secretKeyRef.title: secretKeyRef

valueFrom.title: valueFrom

env.title: env

exposeType.description: Specify what kind of Service you want. options: "ClusterIP", "NodePort", "LoadBalancer", "ExternalName"
exposeType.title: exposeType

image.description: Which image would you like to use for your service
image.title: image

imagePullPolicy.description: Specify image pull policy for your service
imagePullPolicy.title: imagePullPolicy

imagePullSecrets.description: Specify image pull secrets for your service
imagePullSecrets.title: imagePullSecrets

labels.description: Specify the labels in the workload
labels.title: labels

livenessProbe.description: Instructions for assessing whether the container is alive.

exec.description: Instructions for assessing container health by executing a command. Either this attribute or the httpGet attribute or the tcpSocket attribute MUST be specified. This attribute is mutually exclusive with both the httpGet attribute and the tcpSocket attribute.

command.description: A command to be executed inside the container to assess its health. Each space delimited token of the command is a separate array element. Commands exiting 0 are considered to be successful probes, whilst all other exit codes are considered failures.
command.title: command

exec.title: exec

failureThreshold.description: Number of consecutive failures required to determine the container is not alive (liveness probe) or not ready (readiness probe).
failureThreshold.title: failureThreshold

httpGet.description: Instructions for assessing container health by executing an HTTP GET request. Either this attribute or the exec attribute or the tcpSocket attribute MUST be specified. This attribute is mutually exclusive with both the exec attribute and the tcpSocket attribute.

path.description: The endpoint, relative to the port, to which the HTTP GET request should be directed.
path.title: path

port.description: The TCP socket within the container to which the HTTP GET request should be directed.
port.title: port

httpGet.title: httpGet

initialDelaySeconds.description: Number of seconds after the container is started before the first probe is initiated.
initialDelaySeconds.title: initialDelaySeconds

periodSeconds.description: How often, in seconds, to execute the probe.
periodSeconds.title: periodSeconds

successThreshold.description: Minimum consecutive successes for the probe to be considered successful after having failed.
successThreshold.title: successThreshold

tcpSocket.description: Instructions for assessing container health by probing a TCP socket. Either this attribute or the exec attribute or the httpGet attribute MUST be specified. This attribute is mutually exclusive with both the exec attribute and the httpGet attribute.

port.description: The TCP socket within the container that should be probed to assess container health.
port.title: port

tcpSocket.title: tcpSocket

timeoutSeconds.description: Number of seconds after which the probe times out.
timeoutSeconds.title: timeoutSeconds

livenessProbe.title: livenessProbe

memory.description: Specifies the attributes of the memory resource required for the container.
memory.title: memory

port.description: Deprecated field, please use ports instead
port.title: port

ports.description: Which ports do you want customer traffic sent to, defaults to 80

expose.description: Specify if the port should be exposed
expose.title: expose

port.description: Number of port to expose on the pod's IP address
port.title: port

protocol.description: Protocol for port. Must be UDP, TCP, or SCTP
protocol.title: protocol

ports.title: ports

readinessProbe.description: Instructions for assessing whether the container is in a suitable state to serve traffic.
